channel.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
channel.description:
Owners of iPhones and other smartphones are one step closer towards taking complete control of their gadgets, thanks to a new government ruling Monday on the practice of "jailbreaking." This weekend has seen a flurry of activity about digital rights, but the biggest news dropped Monday morning, when the FCC announced that it had made the controversial practice of “jailbreaking” your iPhone — or any other cell phone — legal.
http://news.yahoo.com/s/ytech_wguy/ytech_wguy_tc3236

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It does. If you send in your iPhone or iPod touch in for repair and it is jailbroken and Apple notice, they won’t repair it and will charge you for postage and packing to send it back.

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:10, topic:351328"][quote author=Aaronnn` link=topic=447685.msg3288286#msg3288286 date=1280359033]
Does mean that your warranty is not voided anymore when you jailbreak? or do you think that they would still do that.
[/quote]
It still voids your warranty.[/quote]Bullshit.

Read full topic

I am disappoint.

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

This is the US government ruling it not to be illegal. Apple would love to be able to tell their customers it is illegal, Steve jobs hates the idea of people who are out there making his device unstable and all un-uniform in appearance.

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Ah, i thought apple was basically saying that it isn’t illegal. Still, apple should have had all the jailbreaking features in the first place (themes etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:351328”]WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH APPLE

IF THEY PROVIDED SUPPORTED EVERYTHING IN THE FIRST PLACE THERE WOULDNT BE JAILBREAKING.[/quote]

Huh, this isn’t just about jail-breaking or Apple? This particular piece of news has no Apple input at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Jailbreaking is now legal
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Thug-life:

As it should of always been, the only time it should be considered illegal or something worth action on the network’s or manufacturers side is if it is being used to damage or misuse their other products or services. Rooting your Android phone or Jailbreaking your iPhone doing legitimate stuff, such as wanting to put your own software on your iPhone without having to go through Apple’s development and app store approval process.

Jailbreaking will be legal whatever you do, downloading apps without permission is the crime.

Read full topic
